citations.narrative:
There is a small man made pond appoximately 50ft x 25ftx3ft that has an excessive accumulation of thick green algae
throughout the water that does not allow for any visual under the water of the bottom or sides of the pond. The pond has
not been properly cleaned or santizied in at least 2 months to allow for or maintain appropriate water quality for the birds
that require clean water sources to swim in. There were no waterfowl swimming in the pond on the 90 deg day during the
inspection. While the waterfowl and other birds contained in the pond area appeared healthy, the pond water quality was
very poor and not acceptable according to current professionally accepted standards.
The buildup of algae and dirt/debris in a pond that is utilized for swimming and drinking or feeding by waterfowl or other
birds in the enclosure can be a possible source of harmful bacteria or other health related issues that could result from
swiming in or injesting the water that is primarily full of algae.
Pools or other aquatic areas with drainage systems must provide adequate drainage and must be located so that all of
the water contained in such pools or other aquatic areas may be effectively eliminated when necessary for cleaning the
pool or other aquatic area or for other purposes. Pools or other aquatic areas without drainage systems must be aerated
and have an incoming flow of fresh water or be managed in a manner that maintains appropriate water quality in
accordance with current professionally accepted standards appropriate for the species.
To be corrected by: September 16, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.157(a)(2) 
   
Water quality. 
There is a small man made pond appoximately 50ft x 25ftx3ft that has an excessive accumulation of thick green algae 
throughout the water that does not allow for any visual under the water of the bottom or sides of the pond. The pond has 
not been properly cleaned or santizied in at least 2 months to allow for or maintain appropriate water quality for the birds 
that require clean water sources to swim in. There were no waterfowl swimming in the pond on the 90 deg day during the 
inspection. While the waterfowl and other birds contained in the pond area appeared healthy, the pond water quality was 
very poor and not acceptable according to current professionally accepted standards. 
 
The buildup of algae and dirt/debris in a pond that is utilized for swimming and drinking or feeding by waterfowl or other 
birds in the enclosure can be a possible source of harmful bacteria or other health related issues that could result from 
swiming in or injesting the water that is primarily full of algae. 
 
 Pools or other aquatic areas with drainage systems must provide adequate drainage and must be located so that all of 
the water contained in such pools or other aquatic areas may be effectively eliminated when necessary for cleaning the 
pool or other aquatic area or for other purposes. Pools or other aquatic areas without drainage systems must be aerated 
and have an incoming flow of fresh water or be managed in a manner that maintains appropriate water quality in 
accordance with current professionally accepted standards appropriate for the species.  
 
To be corrected by: September 16, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
 n
